definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: I think one of the biggest challenges most translators face is finding work.
sentences.chinese: 我想对于大部分翻译者来说最大的挑战之一是找工作。

sentences.english: One of the TF2 wiki Traditional Chinese translator.
sentences.chinese: 一个TF2维基繁体中文翻译者。

sentences.english: Leila: The project started off with volunteer translators from around the world.
sentences.chinese: 项目开始于世界各地的志愿翻译者。

sentences.english: This step is one small way to help translators provide more suitable translation.
sentences.chinese: 这个步骤可以帮助翻译者提供更适合的翻译。

sentences.english: This kind of writing, with its brilliantly allusive language, poses an uncommon challenge to the translator.
sentences.chinese: 这种巧于用典的文笔对翻译者来说是个不寻常的挑战。

sentences.english: The author discovered that the translator had foisted several passages into his book.
sentences.chinese: 作者发现翻译者偷偷在他的原著中插入了几段文章。

sentences.english: The Holy Spirit is the translator of the laws of God to those who do not understand them.
sentences.chinese: 圣灵乃是那些还不了解上主天律之人的翻译者。

sentences.english: I wish to go to institute on the translator.
sentences.chinese: 我想要去在翻译者身上设立。

sentences.english: Bloggers and translators can also subscribe to our Silex mailing lists.
sentences.chinese: 博客作者和翻译者也可以订阅我们的邮件列表。
